stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes a long-term impact of the transatlantic slave trade on Africa?

features.html:
• The map is centered on the south Atlantic Ocean and shows the following continents:
    • North America
    • South America
    • Europe
    • Asia
    • Africa
  • The map depicts numbers of enslaved people transported from Africa to various parts of the world from 1500 to 1900. The numbers are as follows:
    • All values are approximate.
    • From West Central Africa to Brazil: 8,000,000
    • From West Africa and West Central Africa to the Caribbean and North America: 11,000,000. These enslaved people were transported as follows:
      • United States: 1,000,000
      • Cuba: 2,000,000
      • Veracruz and Cartagena: 1,000,000
      • Jamaica: 4,000,000
      • St. Domingue: 2,000,000
      • Barbados: 1,000,000
    • From West Africa to North Africa: 4,000,000
    • From West Africa to Europe: fewer than 1,000,000
    • From West Africa and from the Swahili Coast of East Africa to Egypt, Arabia, Asia, and India: 8,000,000
    • From the Swahili Coast of East Africa and from Madagascar to the Mascarene Islands: 1,000,000
    • From the Swahili Coast of East Africa to Rio de la Plata: 1,000,000

choicesHtml: African societies suffered the generational loss of potential leaders who would have passed down important cultural knowledge.
African empires gained power and global influence through the wealth accumulated from the slave trade.
African kingdoms regained control of their territories and resisted further European invasion.
African states located along the western coast were depopulated and came under foreign control.
